original_instructions:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
In a bowl combine well the potatoes and the egg, stir in the flour thoroughly, and stir in the onion, chives, and salt and pepper, to taste.
In a large heavy skillet, heat 1/8-inch of the oil over moderately high heat until it is hot but not smoking. Fry heaping tablespoons of the potato mixture, flattening them slightly with the back of the spoon, for 1 minute on each side, or until they are golden brown. Transfer the pancakes as they are cooked to paper towels to drain and if desired, keep them warm on a rack set on a baking sheet in a preheated 250 degree F oven. Serve the pancakes as an accompaniment to meat, poultry, or eggs.
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 250 degrees F.
In a bowl, combine 0.5 cup mashed potatoes and 0.25 large egg.
Stir in 1.5 tablespoons all-purpose flour thoroughly.
Stir in 0.38 tablespoons grated onion, 0.5 tablespoon chives, and salt and pepper to taste.
Heat 1/8-inch of vegetable oil in a large heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking.
Fry heaping tablespoons of the potato mixture, flattening them slightly with the back of the spoon, for 1 minute on each side, or until golden brown.
Transfer the pancakes as they are cooked to paper towels to drain.
If desired, keep them warm on a rack set on a baking sheet in the preheated 250 degree F oven.

original_instructions: In a stainless steel saucepan combine the raspberries with vinegar to barely cover them and the sugar. Bring this to a boil, slowly, skim off frothy scum and let cool to room temperature. Strain, pressing down on the fruit. Refrigerate the liquid. Use as an intense syrup with club soda, gingerale; vodka as well and other fruit.
step_by_step_instructions: Measure approximately 1/4 pint of raspberries.
Place the raspberries in a stainless steel saucepan.
Add enough balsamic vinegar to barely cover the raspberries.
Add 1 cup of sugar to the saucepan.
Slowly bring the mixture to a boil.
Skim off any frothy scum that forms on the surface.
Let the mixture cool to room temperature.
Strain the mixture, pressing down on the fruit to extract the liquid.
Refrigerate the strained liquid.
Use the refrigerated liquid as a syrup with club soda, ginger ale, vodka, or other fruit.

original_instructions:
Place the sweet potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water by 2 inches. Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook just until the sweet potatoes can be easily pierced with a paring knife, 30 to 35 minutes.
Remove the sweet potatoes from the water, let stand until cool enough to handle, then cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges. Brush the wedges with the olive oil; sprinkle with the chili powder and a little salt.
Preheat a grill to medium-high. Grill the sweet potato wedges, turning once, until well-marked on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Remove to a platter. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, plus more for finishing
step_by_step_instructions: Place approximately 1 large sweet potato in a large pot and cover with cold water by 2 inches.
Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat and cook just until the sweet potato can be easily pierced with a paring knife, about 30 to 35 minutes.
Remove the sweet potato from the water, let stand until cool enough to handle, then cut into 1/2-inch-thick wedges.
Brush the wedges with about 0.50 tablespoon of olive oil; sprinkle with approximately 0.75 teaspoon of chili powder and a little salt.
Preheat a grill to medium-high heat.
Grill the sweet potato wedges, turning once, until well-marked on both sides, about 5 minutes per side.
Remove to a platter.
Drizzle with a small amount of olive oil and sprinkle with a bit more salt.

original_instructions:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Squeeze the excess water from the spinach and put it in a large mixing bowl. Add the remaining ingredients and mix well by hand.* Form the mixture into 1-inch balls, either by hand or with a small ice cream scoop. Place the balls closely together on a baking sheet.
Cook in the top half of the oven until firm to the touch, about 20 to 25 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes, and then transfer to a platter and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 pound package frozen chopped spinach, thawed
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Squeeze the excess water from approximately 2.67 ounces of spinach and put it in a large mixing bowl.

Add approximately 1 egg, 0.33 ounces of minced onion, 2 tablespoons of melted margarine, 0.17 cups of shredded Parmesan, 0.33 cloves of minced garlic, 0.08 teaspoons of dried thyme leaves, 0.08 teaspoons of cayenne, and 0.29 cups of Italian-style bread crumbs to the bowl.
Mix well by hand.
Form the mixture into 1-inch balls, either by hand or with a small ice cream scoop.
Place the balls closely together on a baking sheet.
Cook in the top half of the oven until firm to the touch, about 20 to 25 minutes.
Let cool for 5 minutes, then transfer to a platter and serve immediately.

original_instructions:
For crust: Position rack in center of oven and preheat oven to 350°F. Wrap outside of 9-inch diameter springform pan with 3-inch -high sides with heavy-duty foil. Combine flour, pecans, butter, sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large bowl. Mix well. Press mixture onto bottom of prepared pan.
Position rack in center of oven and preheat oven to 350°F. Wrap outside of 9-inch diameter springform pan with 3-inch -high sides with heavy-duty foil. Combine flour, pecans, butter, sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large bowl. Mix well. Press mixture onto bottom of prepared pan.
For filling: Using electric mixer, beat cream cheese in large bowl until smooth. Gradually beat in sugar. Beat in cornstarch. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating until just blended after each addition. Add puréed banana, sour cream, lemon juice, vanilla, cinnamon and salt. Beat just until combined. Transfer filling to crust-lined pan. Place pan in large roasting pan. Add enough hot water to roasting pan to come 1 inch up sides of springform pan. Bake until center of cake is just set, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove cake from oven. Maintain oven temperature.
Using electric mixer, beat cream cheese in large bowl until smooth. Gradually beat in sugar. Beat in cornstarch. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating until just blended after each addition. Add puréed banana, sour cream, lemon juice, vanilla, cinnamon and salt. Beat just until combined.
Transfer filling to crust-lined pan. Place pan in large roasting pan. Add enough hot water to roasting pan to come 1 inch up sides of springform pan. Bake until center of cake is just set, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Remove cake from oven. Maintain oven temperature.
Meanwhile, prepare topping: Mix together sour cream, sugar and vanilla in small bowl until well blended. Spread topping over cheesecake. Bake until topping is set, about 10 minutes. Turn off oven. Let cake stand in oven until cooled to room temperature, about 2 hours. Refrigerate cake until well chilled. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Cut around cake to loosen; remove pan sides. Transfer cake to platter. Warm caramel sauce in small saucepan over low heat, stirring often. Mix in rum. Drizzle some sauce decoratively over cake. Arrange bananas top cake. Cut cake into wedges. Serve, passing remaining sauce separately.
Mix together sour cream, sugar and vanilla in small bowl until well blended. Spread topping over cheesecake. Bake until topping is set, about 10 minutes. Turn off oven. Let cake stand in oven until cooled to room temperature, about 2 hours. Refrigerate cake until well chilled. Cover and refrigerate overnight.
Cut around cake to loosen; remove pan sides. Transfer cake to platter. Warm caramel sauce in small saucepan over low heat, stirring often. Mix in rum. Drizzle some sauce decoratively over cake. Arrange bananas top cake.
Cut cake into wedges. Serve, passing remaining sauce separately.
ingredients: 2 8-ounce packages Neufchâtel cheese (reduced-fat cream cheese), room temperature
step_by_step_instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Wrap the outside of a small springform pan with aluminum foil.
Mix 0.19 cup flour, 0.19 cup finely chopped pecans, 1 tablespoon melted butter, 0.75 tablespoon sugar, 0.5 tablespoon brown sugar, and 0.38 teaspoon vanilla extract in a bowl.
Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared pan to form the crust.
Using an electric mixer, beat 4 ounces cream cheese until smooth.
Gradually add 0.31 cup sugar and 0.5 tablespoon cornstarch, beating until smooth.
Add 1 egg, beating until just blended.
Mix in 0.5 cup puréed bananas, 0.25 cup sour cream, 0.38 tablespoon lemon juice, 0.25 teaspoon vanilla extract, 0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and a pinch of salt.
Pour filling into the crust-lined pan.
Place the pan in a larger roasting pan and add hot water to come 1 inch up the sides.
Bake for approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes until the center is just set.
For the topping, combine 0.25 cup sour cream, 0.06 cup sugar, and 0.06 teaspoon vanilla extract in a small bowl.
Spread the topping over the baked cheesecake.
Bake for an additional 10 minutes until the topping is set.
Turn off the oven and let the cake cool in the oven for about 2 hours.
Refrigerate the cake until well chilled, preferably overnight.
Carefully remove the cake from the pan and transfer it to a serving platter.
Warm about 1.06 ounces caramel sauce in a saucepan over low heat and mix in 0.25 tablespoon dark rum.
Drizzle some sauce over the cake and arrange slices of 0.5 banana on top.
Cut the cake into wedges and serve with additional sauce on the side.
